description: Fatty acid synthesis is the creation of fatty acids from acetyl-CoA and NADPH through the action of enzymes called fatty acid synthases. This process takes place in the cytoplasm of the cell. Most of the acetyl-CoA which is converted into fatty acids is derived from carbohydrates via the glycolytic pathway. Source: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fatty_acid_synthesis Wikipedia]
title: Fatty acid biosynthesis
